divs: Sighting DetailsSo it all started while standing in the Montclair Plaza Mall parking lot. It was pretty late and we were hanging out talking. I was standing, facing East and a friend I was talking to was facing West. Halfway through a sentence he yells "SH--! LOOK!" and points to the Western sky behind me. I whip around to see a reddish orange fireball around the size of a full moon sailing across the sky in a 4 o'clock direction, and disappear behind the JC Penney building. I really can't tell how far away this was, but it made no sound. It had the appearance of a meteorite coming down, but the only thing that makes me question it is the sheer magnitude of it. Later on the same morning, I had a meeting at work, and come to find out, one of my coworkers had also seen it from Pomona (7-8 miles West of Montclair) and said it was far off in the Western sky and gave a perfect description of it to me before I had told him any of the details about it first. The hairs on my neck rose right about then... Please feel free to drop me a line if you have seen this event or have any information. My email is daniel_remillard@yahoo.com
